metadata.Title: CVE-2014-3587 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Integer overflow in the cdf_read_property_info function in cdf.c in file through 5.19, as used in the Fileinfo component in PHP before 5.4.32 and 5.5.x before 5.5.16, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted CDF file.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of an incomplete fix for CVE-2012-1571.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3587` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

file - 1:5.14-2ubuntu3.2
libmagic1 - 1:5.14-2ubuntu3.2
python-magic - 1:5.14-2ubuntu3.2
python3-magic - 1:5.14-2ubuntu3.2
No subscription required

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4

criterions.comment: file package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:5.14-2ubuntu3.2').
php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.4').
